com.percussion.extensions.general
Class PSGetBase64Encoded

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.extension.PSSimpleJavaUdfExtension
      com.percussion.extensions.general.PSGetBase64Encoded
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPSExtension, IPSUdfProcessor
Direct Known Subclasses:
PSGetBase64EncodedBody
public class PSGetBase64Encoded
extends PSSimpleJavaUdfExtension

This class implements the UDF processor interface so it can be used as a Rhythmyx function. See processUdf for a description.

Method Detail

processUdf

public Object processUdf(Object[] params,
                         IPSRequestContext request)
                  throws PSConversionException
Firts this creates a URL from the supplied parameters and attaches the pssessionid as one of the html parameters. It then makes an internal request using the created URL, base64 encodes the results and returns it. The URL server and port are set to the Rhythmyx server's address and port.

A URI has the following pieces for purposes of this description (see RFC 2396 for more details):

<scheme>://<host><path-segments> <resource>?<query>#<fragment>

All parts except resource are optional.

Five basic forms are allowed for the supplied URI:

  • Fully qualified (e.g. http://server:9992/Rhythmyx/approot/res.html
  • Partially qualified (e.g. /Rhythmyx/approot/res.html)
  • Relative (e.g. ../myApp/res.html)
  • Resource name only (e.g. res.html)
  • An empty string.

Any of these forms may contain a query and fragment part. Any relative url is assumed to be relative from the orginiating request's app root.

If the supplied URL is fully qualified and the protocol is not 'http', or 'https', an empty String is returned. Otherwise, any pieces supplied will be substituted. If the supplied URL is not fully qualified, the missing parts will be added. For a partially qualified name, the http protocol, server and port will be added to the supplied name. For an unqualified name, these items, plus the Rhythmyx request root and the originating application request root will be added. For a relative name, the http protocol, server, port, and Rhythmyx root will be added, assuming it is relative from the originating requests app root. For an empty string, the app root of the originating request will be used, substituting the supplied parameters. Regardless of whether the originating request is using https, or if the supplied URL is fully qualified and specifies 'https', the URL used to make the internal request will always use 'http'.

Multiple name/value pairs may be specified for the parameters. For example, if the following were supplied as parameters:

  • resource = query1.html
  • param1 = city
  • value1 = Boston
  • param2 = state
  • value2 = MA
and the session identifier was sessionid, then the following URL would be generated (the params do not necessarily appear in the order presented):

http://127.0.0.1:9992/Rhythmyx/MyApp/query1.html? pssessionid=sessionid&city=Boston&state=MA

Note: The resource may contain parameters defined on it, in which case the session id will be appended after the last parameter defined therein.

Parameters:
params - An array with elements as defined below. The array is processed from beginning to end. As soon as the first null parameter is encountered (null values allowed), processing of the parameters will stop.
Param #DescriptionRequired?default value
1 The path to the resource. no ""
2 * N The name of the Nth parameter no none
2 * N + 1 The value of the Nth parameter no none
request - The current request context, not null.
Returns:
a base64 encoded string of the results making an internal request with the URL created from the provided parameters, never null, might be empty.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if any supplied parameter is null.
PSConversionException - If the url cannot be constructed.

getInputStream

protected InputStream getInputStream(com.percussion.HTTPClient.HttpURLConnection conn)
                              throws IOException
Gets an input stream from which the data in the response may be read. Internally calls HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(). The derived classes can override this method to for example do some custom response data filtering.

Parameters:
conn - HTTP connection, never null.
Returns:
input stream with the response data, never null.
Throws:
IOException - if for any reason it fails to get the input stream.
